intro: Eugenia monticola var. flavovirens, commonly known as the golden-green eugenia, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that exhibit a striking combination of green and yellow hues. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by edible, reddish-purple berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant in warm climates.
